newsitem.title: GABON: Gabon summit on Zaire ends, calls for peace.
newsitem.headline: Gabon summit on Zaire ends, calls for peace.

text.p: A regional summit between Zaire's President Mobutu Sese Seko and a handful of his French-speaking African colleagues ended on Thursday with a call for peace in his troubled nation.
A statement after the summit called for previous accords on Zaire to be respected and for the setting up of a regional centre for conflict resolution.

Heads of state of Gabon, Chad, the Central African Republic, Congo and Equatorial Guinea met for most of the afternoon without Mobutu, who is ailing with prostate cancer. Cameroon, chairing the Organisation of African Unity (OAU), was represented by the foreign minister.

Rebel leader Laurent Kabila has said he will drive Mobutu from his capital Kinshasa if he does not hand over power before rebel fighters arrive. Residents say they are around 200 km (125 miles) from the city.
When an evidently tired Mobutu was asked by reporters if he would be returning home he replied: "Why shouldn't I go back?"
